description.narrative: To extend Forest Service efforts to improve forest policies and practices internationally, address climate change, conserve and protect critical global forest environments and resources, and improve the lives of forest-dependent peoples by awarding grants to and entering into cooperative agreements with nonprofit organizations, multilateral organizations, and other individuals, organizations, institutions, and governments engaged in forest conservation and management.

description.narrative: From February 20-27, 2016, APHIS/Brasilia working with APHIS/Bolivia implemented a condensed version of the ITAD course in Paraguay in February 2016.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses
Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

title.narrative: Visit of the SENACSA authorities of Paraguay for the verification of the Export American system of agricultural products

description.narrative: From September 3-10, 2016, the SENACSA Authorities of Paraguay visited of the Verification of the American System of Agriculture Workshop held in the United States. The United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) uses different certificates to export products of animal origin, live animals and genetic material to all countries in the world, guaranteeing animal health and safety of the products to be exported.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses
Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

description.narrative: Under the 2014-16 Agreement between IICA and APHIS-IS for Plant and Animal Health capacity building, IICA with support from the regional NPPOs and in particular from the Paraguay NPPO. The objective of this activity is to review with plant health officials - key Phytosanitary principles that countries must focus on to protect domestic plant resources and to enable the trade of agricultural products.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses
Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

description.narrative: APHIS participated in a training program for Paraguay Plant Heath Service (SENAVE) officials, in coordination with Interamerican Institute for Ag Cooperation (IICA) and the University of Asuncion. The training program involved a series of lectures given by APHIS on topics including basic aspects of trade of agricultural products (including risk assessments), market access and rulemaking, phytosanitary treatments for pest mitigation, as well as inspection activities conducted in the United States to protect U.S. agriculture. A total of 38 local inspectors participated in this training.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Agricultural Quarantine Inspection User Fee Account

description.narrative: The Food for Progress Program provides for the donation of U.S. agricultural commodities to developing countries and emerging democracies that are committed to introducing or expanding free enterprise in their agricultural economies. The program has two primary strategic objectives: (1) increase agricultural productivity and (2) expand trade of agricultural products.

description.narrative: The Scientific Cooperation Research Program supports joint research, extension, and education projects lasting up to two years among domestic and international agricultural professionals. These projects address issues including agricultural trade and market access, animal and plant health, biotechnology, food safety and security, and sustainable natural resource management.
